toyrobot

Class ToyRobot

  • java.lang.Object
    • toyrobot.ToyRobot

  • public class ToyRobot
extends java.lang.Object
    Java Class Library to simulate a toy robot on a 5x5 board.
    Author:
    Shaun Chua

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ToyRobot()
      Constructs a null ToyRobot that can be used manually.

      Constructs a new ToyRobot object.
      ToyRobot(int X, int Y, toyrobot.ToyRobot.Direction DIRECTION)
      Constructs a new ToyRobot object.
      ToyRobot(java.lang.String position)
      Constructs a new ToyRobot object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ToyRobot

        public ToyRobot()
        Constructs a null ToyRobot that can be used manually.

      • ToyRobot

        public ToyRobot(int X,
                int Y,
                java.lang.String direction)
        Constructs a new ToyRobot object.
        Parameters:
        X - An integer indicating X position on the board.
        Y - An integer indicating Y position on the board.
        direction - A string indicating the direction the ToyRobot is facing on the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are not recognized.

      • ToyRobot

        public ToyRobot(int X,
                int Y,
                toyrobot.ToyRobot.Direction DIRECTION)
        Constructs a new ToyRobot object.
        Parameters:
        X - An integer indicating X position on the board.
        Y - An integer indicating Y position on the board.
        DIRECTION - A direction data-type indicating the direction the ToyRobot is facing on the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are not recognized.

      • ToyRobot

        public ToyRobot(java.lang.String position)
        Constructs a new ToyRobot object.
        Parameters:
        position - A string of information of the form X,Y,Direction to place the ToyRobot.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are not recognized.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(int X,
                int Y,
                java.lang.String DIRECTION)
        Set the parameters for a ToyRobot object.
        Parameters:
        X - An integer indicating X position on the board.
        Y - An integer indicating Y position on the board.
        DIRECTION - A string indicating the direction the ToyRobot is facing on the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if inputs are not recognized.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the X position of the ToyRobot.
        Returns:
        Integer indicating the X value.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the Y position of the ToyRobot.
        Returns:
        Integer incidating the Y value.

      • getDirection

        public java.lang.String getDirection()
        Get the Direction which the ToyRobot is currently facing.
        Returns:
        String indicating the direction facing.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Delete the parameter information of this ToyRobot. Results in ToyRobot with information 0,0,null.

      • move

        public void move()
        MOVE command. Moves the ToyRobot forward 1 space in the direction it is facing. NORTH = Y++ SOUTH = Y-- EAST = X++ WEST = X--
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if robot is not valid.

      • left

        public void left()
        LEFT command. Rotates the ToyRobot anti-clockwise (left) from the current direction. NORTH = WEST SOUTH = EAST EAST = NORTH WEST = SOUTH
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if robot is not valid.

      • right

        public void right()
        RIGHT command. Rotates the ToyRobot clockwise (RIGHT) from the current direction. NORTH = EAST SOUTH = WEST EAST = SOUTH WEST = NORTH
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if robot is not valid.

      • report

        public void report()
        REPORT command. Returns a printed statement to the terminal providing information on this ToyRobot. Output: X,Y,Direction is expected.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if robot is not valid.
